topic.title: PHY <-> FlexE <-> OTN CBR Mapping Datapaths

li.p: 10GE FlexE client adapted for BMP mapping into OTN (2a).
25GE FlexE client adapted for BMP mapping into OTN (2b).
50GE FlexE client adapted for BMP mapping into OTN (2c).
100GE FlexE client adapted for GMP mapping into OTN (2d).
200GE FlexE client adapted for BMP mapping into OTN (2e).
FlexE group for FlexE aware BGMP mapping into OTN with or without crunching (2g).
Any FlexE client rate using IMP adaption for mapping into OTN (2h).

body.p: On the receive path, the different 100GE PHYs of a FlexE Group comes from SERDES and then go through the PHY RX blocks that performs the PMA, FEC and PCS receive functions. The traffic goes to the FLEX_DEMUX with the option to terminate the FLexE Group and extract the FlexE clients or with the option to adapt the stream for FlexE aware mapping.

When terminating the FlexE Group and for BMP or GMP mapping, idle compensation is done by the FEMP to adapt the clients into nominal rates. The adaptation is done by listening to the ECPB buffer FIFO fill level. Code words are then forwarded to the ECPB mapping buffer. The nominal rate information is given to the MAPOTN subsystem outside of the ENET.

When terminating the FlexE Group and for ODUflex IMP mapping, all idles are deleted by the FEMP and packets are sent to the ECPB buffer. The IMP_MAP block within the MAPOTN then insert idles to create a nominal rate stream by listening to the ECPB buffer FIFO zone. The nominal rate information is given to the MAPOTN subsystem outside of the ENET.

When not terminating the FlexE, the FLEXE_DEMUX will interleave the PHYs into 1 or more (sub)groups and adapt them for FlexE aware mapping. While doing the interleaving, the FLEXE_DEMUX can optionally crunch the unavailable timeslots to save bandwidth. The FlexE (sub)group rate information is derived from the FlexE and is given to the MAPOTN subsystem outside of the ENET. The IMP_MAP block within the MAPOTN then extract the traffic and forwards it for mapping into OTN using BGMP.
On the transmit path, the MAPOTN subsystem demaps the FlexE clients or the FLexE aware stream. For FlexE termination, the clients are either demapped from BMP, GMP or IMP.

When demapping from BMP or GMP, the MAPOTN demaps code words and transfer them across the ECPB demapping buffer. Data then goes through the FEDP that performs demapping adaptation functions. For interworking between the demap client rate and required FlexE client rate, the FEDP listen to the ECPB buffer fill level and delete idles that match the rate required by the FLEXE_MUX. The FLEXE_MUX mutliplex these clients into a Flex group. The PHY rate information (usually nominal) is given to the SERDES outside the ENET subsystem.

When demapping from ODUflex IMP, the IMP_DEMAP block within the MAPOTN deletes all idles and stores packets into the ECPB demapping buffer. Data then goes to the FEDP that performs demapping adaptation functions. The FEDP creates as many idles as required to match the rate required by the FLEXE_MUX. The FLEXE_MUX mutliplex these clients into a Flex group. The PHY rate information (usually nominal) is given to the SERDES outside the ENET subsystem. The SERDES then backpressure the TX PHY and the FLEXE_MUX.

For FlexE aware demapping, the IMP_MAP block within the MAPOTN demaps the traffic and stores the code words into the ECPB demapping buffer. Data then goes to the FEDP that performs demapping adaptation functions. The FLEXE_MUX will de-interleave the PHYs from 1 or more (sub)groups. While doing the de-interleaving, the FLEXE_MUX will restore any timeslots that have been crunched to save bandwidth. The FlexE group and PHY information is derived from the demapped aware streams and is given to the SERDES outside of the ENET.

The different 100GE PHYs of a FlexE Group are sent to the PHY TX block that perform the PMA, FEC and PCS transmit functions. Optional non-intrusive PMON can be achieved by taking the FEDP output and broadcasting it toward the FLEXE_DEMUX and FEPP_E. Optional packet extraction can be achieved using the FEPP_E.

draft-comment.author: hookerje
draft-comment.i: [DDD/HWS] SW/Apps to add API and datapath segment configuration content here.
